quotes.quote: Men's fame is like their hair, which grows after they are dead, and with just as little use to them.
I'm a big woman. I need big hair.
I'm undaunted in my quest to amuse myself by constantly changing my hair.
I've discovered that how I look is not a function of anything as ephemeral as my hair.
Men don't get smarter as they grow older, they just lose their hair.
What a curious way to do your hair— or, rather, not to do it.
I'm losing my hair where I want hair, and getting hair where I don't.
I'm fine, but you're obviously having a bad hair day.
I've had hangovers before, but this time even my hair hurts.
If you want to get ahead in business, you've got to have serious hair.
My blackness has never been in my hair. Blackness is not a hairstyle.
You never see a man walking down the street with a woman who has a little potbelly and a bald spot.
The tenderest spot in a man's makeup is sometimes the bald spot on top of his head.
My real hair color is  kind of a dark blonde. Now I just have mood hair.
I'm not offended by all the dumb-blonde jokes because I know that I'm not dumb. I also know I'm not blonde.
I refuse to think of them as chin hairs. I think of them as stray eyebrows.

Oh, who is that young sinner with the handcuffs on his wrists? / And what has he been after that they groan and shake his fists? / And wherefore is he wearing such a conscience-stricken air? / Oh, they're taking him to prison for the colour of his hair.
You look like you comb your hair with an eggbeater.
I got my hair highlighted because I felt that some strands were more important than others.
A celebrity is any well-known TV or movie star who looks like he spends more than two hours working on his hair.
I read somewhere that hair grows until you reach 40, then it goes in the opposite direction, into the head, and out the ears, nose and other odd places.
I cleaned the attic with the wife the other day. Now I can't get the cobwebs out of her hair.
Even geniuses can get things wrong. Look at Einstein’s unfortunate choice of a hairdresser.
Naturally curly hair is a curse, and don't ever let anyone tell you different.
Her hair was a glory of tendrils for the snaring of husbands.
If my hair gets any frizzier, I'll shave it to the scalp. Or light it on fire. Whichever is easier.
My toes are a total wreck, my fingernails worse, and god knows my hair could use a registered nurse.
